active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs of media sanitization methods (Clear, Purge, Destroy) when retiring laptops containing PII in a penetration testing firm: cost vs. security effectiveness vs. time, considering real-world breaches like unsanitized recycled drives.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking (Social Engineering Testing > 001_Legal, Ethical, and Compliance Considerations > 012_Data Protection and Privacy > Secure Storage Requirements). Generate 40-60 high-quality flashcards using the provided schema. Cover the topic hierarchy fully, integrating: - Learning objectives (span all Bloom's levels as listed). - Scaffolding layers (group flashcards by layer 1-4). - Active learning ties (hint at discussion/peer/problem-solving in explanations). - Research context: CIA triad, storage infra, NIST SP 800-88 (Clear: overwrite; Purge: degauss/encrypt erase; Destroy: shred/incinerate by media), SP 800-209 (access control, encryption, logging), SP 800-53 (MP/AC/SC controls), examples (breaches from poor sanitization), social engineering links (phishing/dumpster diving). Flashcard rules: - 60-70% MCQs with 4 options (1 correct, 3 distractors per protocol). - 30-40% Q&A/cloze. - Balance: 20% per layer, progressive Bloom's (more remember early, create late). - Explanations: NIST ref, CIA/social eng link, example, Bloom's indicator. - Distractors: plausible misconceptions/edges. Output ONLY a JSON array: [{'type': 'MCQ|Q&A', 'layer': 1-4, 'blooms_level': 'REMEMBER|etc', 'front': 'question/options', 'back': 'answer + full explanation'}]. No extra text.
